title: 112_s2271
content: The "Small Business Election Simplification Act" allows for an extension of time for making S Corporation elections. The Small Business Election Simplification Act amends the rules for making S Corporation elections under section 1362 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The amendment allows small business corporations to make the election for any taxable year during the period beginning on the first day of the taxable year and ending on the due date for filing the return. The Small Business Election Simplification Act allows small business corporations to make an S Corporation election for any taxable year within a specified period. If certain requirements are not met before the election is made, it will be treated as made for that taxable year. The Small Business Election Simplification Act allows small business corporations to make an S Corporation election for any taxable year within a specified period. If an election is made after the due date for filing the return for a specific year but before the due date for the following year, it will be treated as made for the following taxable year. The Small Business Election Simplification Act allows small business corporations to make an S Corporation election within a specified period. For existing C corporations, the election can be made during the preceding taxable year or on or before the 15th day of the 3rd month of the taxable year. If an election is made during the first 2 1/2 months, it will be treated as made for the next taxable year. The Small Business Election Simplification Act allows small business corporations to make an S Corporation election within a specified period. If an election is made during the first 2 1/2 months of the taxable year, it will be treated as made for the next taxable year, provided certain requirements are met. If a small business corporation makes an S Corporation election after the 15th day of the 3rd month of the taxable year but before the 15th day of the 3rd month of the following year, the election will be treated as made for the following taxable year. If an S Corporation election is made after the 15th day of the 3rd month but before the 15th day of the following year, it will be treated as made for the next taxable year. Late elections may be treated as timely if there was reasonable cause for the delay. The Secretary may treat a late S Corporation election as timely made for the taxable year by filing a prescribed form. The election can be included in a timely filed small business corporation return with consents of all stockholders. The Secretary has authority to provide necessary guidance for applying this subsection. Revocations of S Corporation elections are also addressed in the Internal Revenue Code. The Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to allow the Secretary to treat late revocations of S Corporation elections as timely made under certain conditions. The amendments made by this section apply to elections for taxable years beginning after the enactment of this Act.
